results.title: The Cooling system and fuel system
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Automobile Maintenance”.
Demonstrates how to check for leaks in the cooling system; check the fan and water pump; mechanical operation of the carburettor; filters and vents; and fuel pumps.

results.title: The Hydraulic brake system
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of Education and Century Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Automobile Maintenance”.
Illustrates how to check brake pedal travel; examine the brake lining; adjust thebrake shoes; inspect shoes; inspect and adjust the hydraulic fluid system - taking care of minor problems prevents major problems.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Automobile Maintenance”.
Shows how to check the cylinder head and block; intake and exhaust manifolds; under-chassis parts; valve mechanism and tappets; vents, screws and air filters; oil filter and oil lines; and cylinder depression.

results.title: The Australian mallee
results.creator_credit: Nandor Jenes, CSIRO and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Australian Wildlife”.
A study of the wildlife of the Victorian Mallee, a land of drifting sand and Mallee Scrub. Small animal life struggles for existence under these poor conditions, where rare waterholes mean life or death. The interesting Mallee Fowl which buries its eggs in incubating mounds, and mysteriously controls its heat; and the Bowerbird which builds a so-called bower for its mating display are shown, together with Wedgetailed eagles, kangaroos, ant lions, honeyeaters and Major Mitchell cockatoos. Photographed by Robert H. Clarke, narrated by Peter Wagner and devised by naturalist Graham Pizzey.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nandor Jenes, CSIRO and Australian Broadcasting Commission

results.title: Ocean pastures
results.creator_credit: Nandor Jenes and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Australian Wildlife”.
The life-cycle of the creatures living at, and in, the sea along the south-eastern Australian shore line. Tiny plankton provide foodstuff for birds and numerous small fish, whilst birds and bigger fish eat the smaller fish. Studies the sea gulls, terns, and the short tailed sheer-water. The fairy penguin and the Australian fur seal are also featured; and underwater life such as seahorses, crabs, octypus, stingrays and sharks. Narrated by Peter Wagner and devised by naturalist, Graham Pizzey.

results.title: The Flooded forest
results.creator_credit: Nandor Jenes and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Australian Wildlife”.
Shows the many varieties of water birds which rear their young in the Barmah red gum forest when the flooding Murray River provides plenty of food. Teals, egrets, and spoonbills are seen. Devised by naturalist, Graham Pizzey.

results.title: Offspring of isolation
results.creator_credit: Nandor Jenes and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Australian Wildlife”.
A survey of Australia’s unique animals, which evolved as a result of Australia’s isolation from other land masses. Platypuses, wombats, kangaroos, echidnas and marsupials are seen in their natural state. Delightful shots of our most appealing fauna. Narrated by Peter Wagner.

results.title: Kangaroos. Part 1. Biography
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Wildlife”.
Part one begins with the evolution of the kangaroo, tracing its development into over 50 species, from tree-dwellers to the better-known “big red”. The feeding, and mating habits of various species are examined, also birth and development in the pouch are studied. Narrated by Lionel Long.

results.title: Kangaroos. Part 2. Varieties
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Wildlife”.
Shows some of the variously adapted species of kangaroos in their natural environments: rat Kangaroos, quokkas, tree kangaroos, forest wallabies, rock wallabies and others.
